noun.description: A measure, quantity, or frequency, typically one measured against some other quantity or measure.
examples: the crime rate rose by 26 percent

noun.description: A fixed price paid or charged for something, especially goods or services.

verb.description: Assign a standard or value to (something) according to a particular scale.
examples: they were asked to rate their ability at different driving maneuvers
the hotel, rated four star, had no hot water and no sink plugs

verb.description: Consider to be of a certain quality, standard, or rank.
examples: the program has been rated a great success
he rates the company's stock a “buy.”

phrases: for the moment, at any rate, he was safe
But at any rate, what taboos will cinema breach after the next twenty-five years, the next fifty?
We know only that the transfer was made, at any rate, according to a public statement by Earl Huntley.
I am, at any rate, tempted to apply it to creatures like Professors Thornton and Campbell.
Such, at any rate, was the answer that rang back at my moment of frustration and paralysis and panic.
origin: Late Middle English: of unknown origin.
